title: How to get Authorization Form from the Bankruptcy Court to talk to my mortgage lender?
question: The bank said that now since my mortgage account is in their bankruptcy department I need to get an Authorization Letter from the bankruptcy court in order for them to talk to me, although I am the owner. Please someone tell me what is the form is called and what is the form number code. I live in CA, thank you.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy court,Automatic stays in bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: They cease contact due to the automatic stay that is imposed however should be able to negotiate reaffirmation with you; reaffirmation is not required. What is it you're trying to accomplish? Lower your monthly payment? That is voluntary , the bankruptcy court does not force loan modifications on lenders. Are you in a CH 7 or 13. If its a CH 13 their should be a rep from the bank at the meetings and payment plan hearings. I advise you see a lawyer.

From my experience (Illinois), the authorization letter is usually mailed to my office by the bank that issued the mortgage or the entity that is servicing the loan. Simply have your attorney request it. Once the authorization form is submitted, you should be able to have direct contact with the bank.

Why do you want to speak with your mortgage lender? First, in a Chapter 7 case, the mortgage companies usually stop sending out payment statements and invoices, so be careful about keeping up-to-date on your payments.

I have never heard of a Bankruptcy Court Authorization Letter. For you to speak with the mortgage company while you're in bankruptcy, you will need your attorney to send a letter to the mortgage lender that authorizes this contact. The mortgage company needs an assurance that they will not be sanctioned for any unlawful communication with you that would be construed as a violation of the automatic stay.
